com.preemptive.annotation.instrumentation

Annotation Type PropertySource


  • @Retention(value=CLASS)
@Target(value={TYPE,CONSTRUCTOR,METHOD})
public @interface PropertySource
    Defines the source of additional properties to be sent with a event.

    This defines a field or method that is the source for a set of properties to be returned with and instrumentation event. If the returned properties are null or empty then no properties will be sent.

    By default all properties are strings and interpreted and collated as strings by the server. Any type of object may be placed in the properties and they are converted to strings using the object's toString(). Numeric properties can be sent to the server by using any of Java's Number classes. For example: 

    
 Properties properties = new Properties();
 // This property is a string
 properties.setProperty("name", theName);
 // This property is also a string
 properties.setProperty("countString", Integer.toString(theCount));
 // This property is a number
 properties.put("countNumber", new Integer(theCount));
 // This property is a string and uses MyObj.toString()
 properties.put("myObject", new MyObj());
    See Also:
    java.util.Properties, ApplicationStart, ApplicationStop, FeatureStart, FeatureStop, FeatureTick, PerformanceProbe, SystemProfile, Specifying Sources and Actions, Dynamic Properties

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String value
      The source for properties to be sent with the event.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract java.lang.String value
        The source for properties to be sent with the event. The type must be Properties.
        See Also:
        Specifying Sources and Actions
